title: Ojima-ojo
author: Ojima-ojo
content: The CEO of thodex a cryptocurrency exchange, Faruk fatih who pulled an exit scam on over 400,000 users of the exchange in 2021 have been arrested in Albania, the Turkish base crypto exchange operator disappeared with over $2 billions of dollars of investors funds and disappearing into thin air since last year before his arrest.The arrest came at the hill of investigation and climbing down of scammers who target exchange and other cryptocurrency investment platforms, this scammy act have been the major set back for cryptocurrency adoption globally as this increase the risk factors attached to cryptocurrency usage and adoption as an alternative.https://www.coindesk.com/policy/2022/08/30/founder-of-turkish-crypto-exchange-thodex-arrested-in-albania/

comments.author: notocactus
comments.body: From user side, prevention is better than cure so users must protect themselves from potential scammers. Not your keys, not your coins is a warning that if you don't own keys, you don't own your coins. Exchanges can scam then exit like Thodex and you can not hope that you will be compensated after the scammers arrested in future. It is hopeless hope.From scammer side, it is a good lesson that you will hardly to live an easy life if you steal money of others. They might be arrested anytime and other consequences will come.

comments.author: mk4
comments.body: Boggles my mind how these CEOs think exit scamming would be a great idea. It's not like he's an anonymous founder of a DeFi platform, he's literally a doxxed owner of a centralized exchange. Yea you've hauled a huge amount of money, but how would you even live a normal life lol knowing that you're being pursued by the authorities.

comments.author: Luffygroove
comments.body: Good news, at least scammers could see this, and hopefully, it can give a deterrent effect so people will think twice if they intend to scam through crypto (although some still can escape and some can't be traced). There is still hope for law enforcement. However, let's all take this as a lesson to not leave our funds in the exchangers even if we think that it's impossible for those exchangers to scam or be hacked. Unfortunately, buddy, it is possible and all is possible in the crypto world. It is best to take a precaution than regret it later. In this world full of uncertainty, we as a consumer should take care of ourselves. Please do all the necessary things to do to guard ourselves.

comments.author: cryptoaddictchie
comments.body: He maybe thought that there are some easy exit ways on such conflict and damages he done. But not so smart to do such thing when you are fully doxxed. But probably this guy wasnt trying to pull off a heist or maybe put in a situation where greediness eat him and do this crime. People only tend to change when it involves money. He either forgot that authorities are kinda strict now when it comes to crypto related matters.

comments.author: eXPHorizon
comments.body: How dare they arrest an Crypto scam artist. They should of let him scam more or have his scam exit .... dear lordy

comments.body: Quote from: mk4 on August 31, 2022, 03:22:49 AMBoggles my mind how these CEOs think exit scamming would be a great idea.
